sub_title: Information Technology Operations Manager at Leidos
summary: Highly adaptable security cleared IT Services Director with extensive senior management experience in leading front -line diverse customer services teams to enable exceptional client outcomes including accomplished leadership of virtual and remote teams. A collaborative and energetic leader comfortable with managing financial and operational budgets and driving continuous service improvements. Proven leader of strategic change and innovation bringing passion for exceeding customers’ expectations and the ability to unleash the potential of others. Accomplished in transition and transformation, business process and global delivery with credible programme and entrepreneurial skills. Member of Women in Technology mentoring programme in partnership with Reed Technology Practice.

education.field_of_study: Computer and Information Sciences and Support Services

profile_positions.description: Telecommunications Specialist that provide troubleshooting, installation and support for the Warfighter Information Network-Tactical Increment 1 (WIN-T Inc. 1). The WIN-T Inc. 1 is a communications network that provides the Army Warfighter with voice, data and video capabilities for use in a tactical environment, utilizing primarily commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) equipment. The system includes the following equipment: Unit Hub Node, Regional Hub Node, Single Shelter Switch (SSS), Joint Network Nodes (JNN), Battalion Command Post Nodes (BnCPN), Network Operations (NetOps), JNN and BnCPN Satellite Transportable Terminals (STTs), and Master Reference Terminals (MRTs).
profile_positions.title: Information Technology Operations Manager

profile_positions.description:
Senior stakeholder relationship engagement at the COO and IT Director level across a group of Trusts which delivered a programmer of change and transformation aligned to the NHS Digital Strategy including:

Implemented a newly adopted governance model which integrated and aligned the trusts across IT Delivery, Security, Commercial and Contract Management and Projects and Programmes Management

Designed and delivered of a programme of service evolution which enhanced the end user experience and engagement and improved the overall delivery of service including relationship strategy approach and collaboration

Leader and accountability for local on site and Global delivery teams across the managed service contract base

Responsible Service Director on a number of high profile Public Sector portfolio bids working closely with the Client Directors and sales specialists presenting strategic client business cases
profile_positions.title: Service Delivery Director

profile_positions.description:
Reporting into VP/ General Manager responsible and accountable for leadership at a Business unit level including successful management and increased optimization of client relationships and business partners.

Working at the CIO/ IT Director level to maintain and enhance relationships and promote business development and innovation

Leading program/project teams consisting of cross functional, global, and virtual groups

Direct supervision of senior team members within the business unit

Cost and profit optimization- accountability for Unit P and L

Risk and Issue management

Provision of demand management, business analysis and transition management

Quality assurance and solution lifecycle management and business sign off

UK Diversity ambassador and active senior coach and mentor
profile_positions.title: Client Unit Business Executive -Telecomms, Media, Industrial and Commercial

profile_positions.description:
Leads a team of 60 staff to include Senior Security Engineers, Senior Network Engineers, Senior Incident Responders, Information Systems Security Officers, and Security Analysts personnel to include multiple subcontractors. As Program Manager, she is responsible for client delivery, budgeting, scheduling, staffing, process implementation and oversight for complex IT support contracts including:
– NOAA Cyber Security Center (NCSC) and Department of Commerce (DOC) Enterprise Security Operations Center (ESOC) Support Contract, a hybrid FFP and T&M delivery order, consisting of Program Management, Security Engineering, SOC and Enterprise SOC Operations, and CIRT Operations tasks that are designed to mitigate NOAA’s cyber risk by protecting, detecting, and remediating threats.

She leads the team to deliver a 99.95% Service Availability across production environments. The team has consistently met project milestones within funding parameters and has enabled the client to expand their mission while doing so at lower cost.
profile_positions.title: NOAA Cyber Security Center Program Manager

volunteer_experiences.description: Retail volunteer collaborating with on site team and customers to raise funds for Mary Stevens Hospice in Stourbridge and Hagley
